intro: Alsine platyphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing annual or perennial herb that typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, often blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually broad and fleshy. It is well adapted to sandy soils and can withstand periods of drought. The species is native to regions of southern Europe and parts of North Africa.
